name: blurringly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is hard to see, remember, or understand clearly, usually because of happening or moving very fast: The film is confusing from the start, with a blurringly fast car chase as the opening sequence that then turns into a flashback. Those years of my youth feel blurringly short in retrospect. Related word
blur
More examplesFewer examplesThe hummingbird stopped at the flower, then darted away with its blurringly fast wings. The blurringly quick striker has scored 11 times for her team this season.
